Finding aid created by

did.abstract: Professor at the University of Michigan School of Social Work; was heavily involved in researching psychosocial rehabilitation of the mentally ill and an advocate of supported education; and researched the affects of mental illness on mothers. Collection consists of correspondence, lectures and speeches, project information and publications completed during her tenure at the University of Michigan and Wayne State University

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Carol T. Mowbray papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Carol T. Mowbray earned a bachelor's degree in psychology and mathematics from Tufts University, and her doctorate in developmental psychology from the University of Michigan. She served as an evaluator at the Michigan Department of Mental Health (MDMH) and for almost a decade was the Director of Research and Demonstration Projects for the Bureau of Program Development and Quality Assurance. She was an Associate Professor at the Wayne State University School of Social Work, and a Professor of Ecological/Community Psychology at Michigan State University. In 1994 she joined the University of Michigan School of Social Work (SSW) as a professor and from 1996-2001 was the SSW Associate Dean of Research.

Mowbray was a prolific author, writing more than 130 scientific articles, chapters and books. She focused on the psychosocial rehabilitation of adults with mental illness, especially homeless populations and those with substance-abuse problems. She developed and evaluated the effectiveness of intervention strategies for mentally ill persons, emphasizing consumer-run and supported education programs. She also developed a specialization in women with mental illness and how it affected motherhood and raising children.

scopecontent.p: The Carol T. Mowbray collection consists primarily of correspondence and project related materials and publications detailing her professional career. This collection is divided into eight series: Personal, Correspondence, Teaching, Conferences, Lectures and Speeches, Committees, Projects and Publications. The collection is organized primarily in alphabetical or chronological order for ease of use. The collection itself is focused on the professional activities of Carol T. Mowbray, and researchers will find few insights into the personal life and character of Carol outside of the work environment.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. School of Social Work.
controlaccess.subject: Mental illness.

scopecontent.p: The Personal series (0.2 linear feet) contains letters of appreciation, Curriculum Vitas, awards and newsclippings. The Curriculum Vitas are notable for their thoroughness and comprehensiveness.

The Correspondence series (1.3 linear feet) consists of correspondence between Mowbray and members of the various organizations and committees of which he was a part. The letters were originally organized in 3-ring binders according to month and year. The letters have been removed from the binders, but retain the same order and separators as before. These letters span all aspects of her work including projects, publications and teaching.

The Teaching series (1.0 linear feet) consists of annual reports, class syllabi and lecture notes, as well as teaching evaluations. The annual reports are very thorough and are great snap-shots of Carol's work in an individual year. Her teaching activities have been divided up by class taught and where applicable into syllabi and lectures.

Social Work 843-Seminar on Poverty, Risk and Mental Health

scopecontent.p: The Conferences series (1.3 linear feet) contains programs, applications and presentations delivered at various conferences she attended. She was largely involved in the International Association of Psychosocial Rehabilitation Services (IAPSRS), American Evaluation Association (AEA) and the American Psychological Association (APA) conferences.

scopecontent.p: The Lectures and Speeches (0.6 linear feet) series comprises materials from various lectures, workshops, and symposiums where Mowbray spoke. This series includes lectures on writing for publishing, dual diagnosis, research ethics and mental illness stigmas.

scopecontent.p: The Committees series (0.8 linear feet) contains materials relevant to committees Mowbray served on. Included in this series are committees within the School of Social Work at the University of Michigan, American Psychological Association and the Action Committee for Women.

University of Michigan Depression Center Steering Committee

scopecontent.p: The Projects series (4.2 linear feet) is the largest series in this collection. It is organized by project title and further subdivided where necessary. Included in these files are project descriptions, meeting minutes, data, reports and proposals. The projects series should be reviewed in tandem with the appropriate project-related publications to provide a full picture of Carol Mowbray's findings and her conclusions.

scopecontent.p: The Publications series (2.2 linear feet) is organized by year published. The first folder, "Bibliography" contains a thorough listing of Carol Mowbray's publications and serves as an index for the many publications Carol has written. Researchers should consult the "Bibliography" to find specific articles and publications. The publications series is not comprehensive, but does contain the articles found within her papers. Located after the articles are materials corresponding to her book projects and other materials.
